inputs.name: command
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: The dotnet command to run. Select 'Custom' to add arguments or use a command not listed here.

inputs.name: publishWebProjects
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true, the task will try to find the web projects in the repository and run the publish command on them. Web projects are identified by presence of either a web.config file or wwwroot folder in the directory.
inputs.label: Publish web projects

inputs.name: projects
inputs.visibleRule: command = build || command = restore || command = run || command = test || command = custom || publishWebProjects = false
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the csproj file(s) to use. You can use wildcards (e.g. **/*.csproj for all .csproj files in all subfolders). **This field follows glob pattern, and is run against root of the repository at all times irrespective of Working Directory.**
inputs.label: Path to project(s)

inputs.name: custom
inputs.helpMarkDown: The command to pass to dotnet.exe for execution.
inputs.label: Custom command

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.visibleRule: command = build || command = publish || command = run || command = test || command = custom
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments to the selected command. For example, build configuration, output folder, runtime. The arguments depend on the command selected.
inputs.label: Arguments

inputs.name: restoreArguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Write the additional arguments to be passed to **restore** command.
inputs.label: Arguments

inputs.name: publishTestResults
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Enabling this option will generate a test results TRX file in `$(Agent.TempDirectory)` and results will be published to the server.
This option appends `--logger trx --results-directory $(Agent.TempDirectory)` to the command line arguments.

Code coverage can be collected by adding `--collect "Code coverage"` option to the command line arguments. This is currently only available on the Windows platform.
inputs.label: Publish test results and code coverage

inputs.name: testRunTitle
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for the test run.
inputs.label: Test run title

inputs.name: zipAfterPublish
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true, folder created by the publish command will be zipped.
inputs.label: Zip published projects

inputs.name: modifyOutputPath
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true, folders created by the publish command will have project's folder name prefixed to their folder names when output path is specified explicitly in arguments. This is useful if you want to publish multiple projects to the same folder.
inputs.label: Add project's folder name to publish path

inputs.helpMarkDown: You can either select a feed from Azure Artifacts and/or NuGet.org here, or commit a nuget.config file to your source code repository and set its path here.
inputs.name: selectOrConfig
inputs.label: Feeds to use

inputs.helpMarkDown: Include the selected feed in the generated NuGet.config. You must have Azure Artifacts installed and licensed to select a feed here.
inputs.name: feedRestore
inputs.label: Use packages from this Azure Artifacts feed

inputs.name: includeNuGetOrg
inputs.label: Use packages from NuGet.org
inputs.helpMarkDown: Include NuGet.org in the generated NuGet.config.

inputs.name: nugetConfigPath
inputs.label: Path to NuGet.config
inputs.helpMarkDown: The NuGet.config in your repository that specifies the feeds from which to restore packages.
Credentials to use for external registries located in the selected NuGet.config. For feeds in this organization/collection, leave this blank; the build’s credentials are used automatically.
inputs.name: externalEndpoints
inputs.label: Credentials for feeds outside this organization/collection

inputs.name: noCache
inputs.helpMarkDown: Prevents NuGet from using packages from local machine caches.
inputs.label: Disable local cache

inputs.name: packagesDirectory
inputs.label: Destination directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the folder in which packages are installed. If no folder is specified, packages are restored into the default NuGet package cache.

inputs.name: verbosityRestore
inputs.label: Verbosity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the amount of detail displayed in the output.

inputs.name: searchPatternPush
inputs.label: Path to NuGet package(s) to publish
inputs.helpMarkDown: The pattern to match or path to nupkg files to be uploaded. Multiple patterns can be separated by a semicolon.
Select a feed hosted in this organization. You must have Azure Artifacts installed and licensed to select a feed here.
inputs.name: feedPublish
inputs.label: Target feed

inputs.name: publishPackageMetadata
inputs.helpMarkDown: Associate this build/release pipeline’s metadata (run #, source code information) with the package
inputs.label: Publish pipeline metadata

inputs.name: externalEndpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: The NuGet service connection that contains the external NuGet server’s credentials.
inputs.label: NuGet server

inputs.name: searchPatternPack
inputs.label: Path to csproj or nuspec file(s) to pack
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Pattern to search for csproj or nuspec files to pack.

You can separate multiple patterns with a semicolon, and you can make a pattern negative by prefixing it with '!'. Example: `**/*.csproj;!**/*.Tests.csproj`

inputs.name: configurationToPack
inputs.label: Configuration to Package
inputs.helpMarkDown: When using a csproj file this specifies the configuration to package

inputs.name: outputDir
inputs.label: Package Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Folder where packages will be created. If empty, packages will be created alongside the csproj file.

inputs.name: nobuild
inputs.helpMarkDown: Don't build the project before packing. Corresponds to the --no-build command line parameter.
inputs.label: Do not build

inputs.name: includesymbols
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additionally creates symbol NuGet packages. Corresponds to the --include-symbols command line parameter.
inputs.label: Include Symbols

inputs.name: includesource
inputs.helpMarkDown: Includes source code in the package. Corresponds to the --include-source command line parameter.
inputs.label: Include Source

inputs.name: versioningScheme
inputs.label: Automatic package versioning
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Cannot be used with include referenced projects. If you choose 'Use the date and time', this will generate a [SemVer](http://semver.org/spec/v1.0.0.html)-compliant version formatted as `X.Y.Z-ci-datetime` where you choose X, Y, and Z.

If you choose 'Use an environment variable', you must select an environment variable and ensure it contains the version number you want to use.

If you choose 'Use the build number', this will use the build number to version your package. **Note:** Under Options set the build number format to be '[$(BuildDefinitionName)_$(Year:yyyy).$(Month).$(DayOfMonth)$(Rev:.r)](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=627416)'.

inputs.name: versionEnvVar
inputs.label: Environment variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the variable name without $, $env, or %.
The 'X' in version [X.Y.Z](http://semver.org/spec/v1.0.0.html)
inputs.name: requestedMajorVersion
inputs.label: Major

inputs.helpMarkDown: The 'Y' in version [X.Y.Z](http://semver.org/spec/v1.0.0.html)
inputs.name: requestedMinorVersion
inputs.label: Minor

inputs.helpMarkDown: The 'Z' in version [X.Y.Z](http://semver.org/spec/v1.0.0.html)
inputs.name: requestedPatchVersion
inputs.label: Patch

inputs.name: buildProperties
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies a list of token = value pairs, separated by semicolons, where each occurrence of $token$ in the .nuspec file will be replaced with the given value. Values can be strings in quotation marks.
inputs.label: Additional build properties

inputs.name: verbosityPack
inputs.label: Verbosity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the amount of detail displayed in the output.

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.visibleRule: command != restore && command != push && command != pack
inputs.helpMarkDown: Current working directory where the script is run. Empty is the root of the repo (build) or artifacts (release), which is $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory). The project search pattern is **NOT** relative to working directory.
inputs.label: Working directory

groups.visibleRule: command != pack && command != push && command != restore
groups.name: generalAdvanced
